name: India
description: India, officially the Republic of India, is a country in South Asia. It’s known for its rich history, diverse culture, and varied geography, ranging from the towering Himalayas in the north to tropical beaches in the south. India is a land of ancient civilizations, vibrant traditions, and a rapidly developing economy, making it one of the world's most fascinating and complex nations.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: India is the most populous country in the world.
quickFacts.detail: As of 2023, India's population exceeds 1.4 billion people, representing a significant portion of the global population.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: India covers a vast area of land.
quickFacts.detail: India's total area is approximately 3.287 million square kilometers, making it the seventh-largest country in the world by area.

quickFacts.label: Languages
quickFacts.description: India boasts a remarkable linguistic diversity.
quickFacts.detail: India recognizes 22 official languages, reflecting its diverse cultural heritage and regional identities.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Indian Rupee (INR) is the official currency of India, subdivided into paise.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: India has a rapidly growing economy.
quickFacts.detail: India's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) in 2023 is estimated to be around USD 3.7 trillion, making it one of the fastest-growing economies globally.

climateData.title: Indian Climate
climateData.description: India experiences a wide range of climates due to its diverse geography. The Himalayan region has alpine climates, while the coastal regions enjoy tropical climates. The Indian monsoon is a defining feature, bringing heavy rainfall during the summer months.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The summer months are characterized by high temperatures and intense heat, particularly in the northern and central parts of the country.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Monsoon (June - September)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The monsoon season brings heavy rainfall across most of India, transforming the landscape and replenishing water resources.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Post-Monsoon (October - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The post-monsoon season is known for pleasant weather, with clear skies and moderate temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter brings cool and dry weather, particularly in the northern and Himalayan regions.

naturalWonders.name: The Himalayas
naturalWonders.description: The Himalayas, the world's highest mountain range, form India's northern border. They are home to iconic peaks like Mount Everest and offer breathtaking scenery and diverse ecosystems.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Himalayan mountain range stretches over 2,400 kilometers, encompassing parts of India, Nepal, Bhutan, China, and Pakistan. It's a region of extreme altitudes, glaciers, and unique flora and fauna. The range plays a crucial role in the Indian monsoon system.

naturalWonders.name: Sundarbans Mangrove Forest
naturalWonders.description: The Sundarbans is the world's largest mangrove forest, located in the delta of the Ganges, Brahmaputra, and Meghna rivers. It's a UNESCO World Heritage Site and home to the Bengal tiger.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Spanning across India and Bangladesh, the Sundarbans is a complex network of tidal waterways, mudflats, and mangrove forests. It’s a vital ecosystem, providing habitat for a diverse range of species, including the endangered Bengal tiger, spotted deer, and various bird species.

scientificData.Biodiversity: Over 200 fish species, 36 mammals, 120 bird species

naturalWonders.name: Valley of Flowers National Park
naturalWonders.description: The Valley of Flowers is a high-altitude Himalayan meadow known for its stunning display of alpine flowers. It's a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a paradise for botanists and nature lovers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in Uttarakhand, the Valley of Flowers is a unique ecosystem characterized by its vibrant meadows carpeted with thousands of flowering plants. The park receives heavy rainfall during the monsoon season, creating a spectacular floral display.

ecosystemData.title: Indian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: India boasts a remarkable diversity of ecosystems, ranging from tropical rainforests to arid deserts and alpine meadows. These ecosystems support a vast array of plant and animal life, contributing significantly to the country's biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: India’s forests cover a significant portion of its land area, playing a vital role in carbon sequestration and biodiversity conservation.

statistics.details: Approximately 29% of India's land area is covered by forests.
India is home to over 30,000 tree species.

notableSpecies.name: Bengal Tiger
notableSpecies.significance: Apex predator and a national symbol.

notableSpecies.name: Indian Elephant
notableSpecies.significance: Keystone species and a symbol of India's heritage.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: India’s extensive coastline supports diverse marine and coastal ecosystems, including coral reefs, mangroves, and estuaries.

statistics.details: India has over 4,000 sq km of coral reefs.
Approximately 7,500 hectares of mangrove areas are protected.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in India
activities.description: India offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from trekking and wildlife safaris to water sports and cultural tours.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore India's stunning mountain trails and scenic landscapes.

activities.name: Trekking in the Himalayas
activities.description: Trek through the majestic Himalayas, experiencing breathtaking views and diverse cultures.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, warm clothing, trekking poles

activities.name: Valley of Flowers Trek
activities.description: Hike through the Valley of Flowers, witnessing a spectacular display of alpine flowers.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, rain gear, camera

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in India's coastal regions and rivers.

activities.name: River Rafting
activities.description: Experience the thrill of river rafting on India's challenging rivers.

activities.name: Scuba Diving & Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the underwater world of India's coral reefs.

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
